greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = 4*binomial(n,k) - 3  for 0 <= k <= n.
comment: Triangle equals 4*A007318 - 3*A000012 as infinite lower triangular matrices. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 21 2007
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
example: First few rows of the triangle are
maple: T := proc (n, k) if k <= n then 4*binomial(n, k)-3 else 0 end if end proc; for n from 0 to 10 do seq(T(n, k), k = 0 .. n) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 21 2007
program: (MAGMA) [4*Binomial(n, k) -3: k in [0..n], n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 12 2020
(Sage) [[4*binomial(n, k) -3 for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 12 2020
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jun 13 2007
